CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 17, 1959, pg. A3 reads:"Last Rites for Kappa Alpha Psi Founder - Funeral services were held for Dr. Marcus P. Blakemore, one of the 10 founders of Kappa Alpha Psi Fraternity, from Ebenezer Baptist Church on Tuesday. He had practiced dentistry here for 35 years.  Death came on Oct. 8 in Pittsburgh Veterans Administration Hospital.  In the lower left photo, pallbearers carry the flag-draped coffin of the World War I veteran.  They are, left front to rear, George Charlton, Polemarch, Pittsburgh Alumni Chapter of Kappa Alpha Psi; Dr. B.O. Holland, Dr. G. Terry and Howard Hailstork.  Right front to rear: Samuel Lawler Jr., Dr. Robert Bolden and William Poole, mortician.... - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Pallbearers, front to rear, left: George Charlton, Dr. B.O. Holland, Dr. G. Terry, and Howard Hailstork; right: Samuel Lawler Jr., Dr. Robert Bolden, and William Poole, carrying flag draped casket of Dr. Marcus P. Blakemore at Ebenezer Baptist Church
